text: this is the firehouse engine a lighted
to where I was assigned to I worked here
for about seven years and I met Monica
outside walking by coming home from work
or anything I'd always be walking down
51st on the way home and walking by the
firehouse so Monica was walking home
from work she just you know she's from
Texas she just happened to strike up a
conversation she just said you know how
was my local firehouse doing but they
all started laughing and kind of broke
the ice and then Danny because my now
fiance he just started talking to me and
that is the sound that you hear when an
alarm goes off in a firehouse and as my
fiance was asking me for my number when
I first walked by here six years ago you
know I was in the middle of giving him
my number when this alarm went off and
he's like you know just hurry up you
know get my number i was like no i'll
come back you know you know and he's
like come on a fire can wait for a
beautiful girl's number I don't know I
just melted and I said you know okay and
so I gave him the rest of my number
called me the next day and now at six
years later and we're about to get
married one of the older guys when I
first got here he told me he said one
day you're gonna meet your future wife
walking by right out front and sure
enough it happened I wanted to work on
film so I thought it would be the
California or New York and I thought I'd
come to New York first and get tough I'm
very quiet very shy and I usually just
like to keep to myself but for some
reason she got me to open up a little
bit it is two different worlds mixing
definitely me saying y'all you know his
friends always tease me about that but
they just sound they have these thick
accents these thick New York accents I
think it's great that she's from Texas
cuz she is she's just different than all
these new york girls you know she's very
outgoing very friendly just a lot of fun
to be with I knew I knew from early on I
want to be with her he's just so
different from anybody I've ever dated
and he's so strong and just knows
everything about everything in New York
and
or we love going to the ritz-carlton in
Battery Park it's great view looks at
the Statue of Liberty in New York Harbor
I was on an all-night shoot for the
movie confessions of a shopaholic it was
probably good that I did the all-night
shift on the movie because i was so
tired that i didn't in delirious that i
didn't have any clue then I just started
telling her you know today is just like
the first day when we met it was
beautiful day outside and and I had just
gotten the new iphone so I'm sitting
there taking pictures of the Statue of
Liberty and he's starting to tell me you
know Monica you know I knew I wanted to
marry you the first you know a couple
weeks that we were dating you know I you
know I love you so much I'm like I know
babe you know he told me that's all the
time I had the ring in my pocket and she
was really just obsessing with the view
and how nice was I'm trying to tell her
you know remember this is just like the
first day we met and you know oh you
know you know how much I love you and me
had to actually come and take my hands
and take the iphone and put it down so
that I could stop you know i was like
what what why are you doing this and
then that's when he grabbed my hand and
got down on one knee and he asked me to
marry him I think she was very shocked
because she even though is our five year
anniversary she really i don't think was
expecting it that day and plus she was
very tired from working all night so
that might have had something to do with
the shock but she was very happy we're
getting married at st. Patrick's and
it's gonna be a beautiful mess and I
remember walking by there maybe you know
a little bit you know less than a year
before I met him and I went in to ask
the priest if you know how it was the
waiting list he said you know well when
are you planning on getting married you
know we'll see if we have the date I was
like oh no I haven't met anybody yet I
was like I just want to you know cover
my bases because if there's a five year
waiting list I meet them in five years
then we're good to go
